Email      Share       Like                                                                Center for Business Analytics   Our Mission  The Center for Business Analytics is a cutting edge research center, and an interdisciplinary community at the forefront of data and analytical thinking. We are thought leaders in the world of data science, blended with business strategy. We create value and opportunity by sparking collaboration among faculty, students, alumni and industry partners related to the strategies, methodologies and critical thinking that inspires data driven decision-making.                                       UPCOMING EVENTS   NYU Symposium on Recent Advances in Multilevel Modeling  May 30, 2014    Register here                 PAST EVENTS   Crowds 2.0:  New Frontiers in Crowdfunding + Crowdsourcing  May 9, 2014     www.crowdsnyustern.com    Crowdfunding and crowdsourcing continue to disrupt and transform markets. Industry and academic experts share what we have learned about these platforms, examine future trends and explore how the wisdom of crowds impacts individuals and organizations.       ADS*CON14  Advertising + Data Science Congress  Co-hosted by the NYU Stern Center for Business Analytics + Dstillery  February 6, 2014    Exploring the impact of the data science revolution on advertising and society. We are thought leaders in the world of data science, blended with business strategy.                                                   Center for Business Analytics   Our Mission  The Center for Business Analytics is a cutting edge research center, and an interdisciplinary community at the forefront of data and analytical thinking. We are thought leaders in the world of data science, blended with business strategy. We create value and opportunity by sparking collaboration among faculty, students, alumni and industry partners related to the strategies, methodologies and critical thinking that inspires data driven decision-making. Berkley Scholarship Program   Loan Programs   Teaching & Graduate Fellowships   Resources for Military Veterans   Resources for Social Enterprise   Tuition & Cost of Attendance     Admissions Request Information   Apply   Selection Criteria   Deadlines   Notification & Process   Application Instructions   Policies   Directors' Tips   FAQs     Meet With Us Visit Stern   Travel Directions   Events and Webinars   Videos   Day in the Life Student Videos   Podcasts   Virtual Tour   Contact a Student               Home / Programs & Admissions / Full-time MBA / Academics / Specializations / Business Analytics                        Share / Print                Print      Email      Share       Like                                              Business Analytics    The specialization in Business Analytics teaches the use of data and models to support decision making in business. Students learn how to model such relationships as the impact of advertising on sales, how historical data predict stock returns, and how changes in task characteristics can influence time to completion.     Sample Courses:                           Data Mining for Business Analytics       Data Visualization       Decision Models       Econometrics       Forecasting Time Series Data       Introduction to Stochastic Processes                           Risk Management Systems       Trading Strategies and Systems       Regression and Multivariate Data Analysis       Research for Customer Insights                        Please note that this is a selection of courses and is subject to change. For more information, visit the course index .             Especially Applicable to Careers in Consulting , Finance and Marketing such as:                           Brand Management       Internal Consulting       Investment Banking       Management Consulting       Marketing                           Operations       Public Finance       Real Estate Finance       Risk Management       Strategic Planning                       Watch the videos below to learn more about Business Analytics at Stern:                      Professor Kristen Sosulski     The Future of Business: Data Visualization                  Professor Anindya Ghose       The
